xxl.core.math.functions
Class AdaptiveAggregationFunction

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.math.functions.AggregationFunction<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>
      xxl.core.math.functions.AdaptiveAggregationFunction
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class AdaptiveAggregationFunction
extends AggregationFunction<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>

This class provides an adaptive online aggregation strategy by performing a convex merging of two objects. This is typically realized with a convex-linear combination of the last returned and every new function delivered by the wrapped aggregation function, i.e. in each step functions are provided and merged. But the user can also realize his own merge procedure based on the current objects and weights.
For the weighting of the functions different strategies exist that allow a time-dependent emphasis of the functions. The strategies in turn are realized with adaptive weight functions.
This function has two phases during runtime (exemplified with functions):
1) Initialize: As far as the internal used (wrapped) aggregation function returns null-objects, the adaptive aggregation function will do this as well. The first non-null object returned by the wrapped function will be stored internally and passed directly to the consumer, i.e., it will be directly returned. 2) Working: For every NEW function returned by the wrapped function, a counter is incremented, the corresponding weight is computed and a linear combination of the old function and the new return function is returned. The code for determining a NEW function looks like 

    
                        if( lastF == newF){
                                return lastF;
                        }
                        else{
                                // COMPUTE new function
                        }
Generally, each aggregation function must support a function call of the following type:
agg_n = f (agg_n-1, next).
There, agg_n denotes the computed aggregation value after n steps, f represents the aggregation function, agg_n-1 the computed aggregation value after n-1 steps and next the next object to use for computation. An aggregation function delivers null as aggregation result as long as the aggregation function has not yet been fully initialized.
For a more detailed discussion concerning the idea of online aggregation we refer to [HHW97]:P. Haas, J. Hellerstein, H. Wang, Online Aggregation, 1997.

See Also:
RealFunction, LinearCombination, AdaptiveWeightFunctions, Function, Serialized Form

Field Detail

function

protected AggregationFunction function
internally used (wrapped) aggregation function providing every k-th step a NEW estimator

weights

protected RealFunction weights
RealFunction that consumes the current step and returns the corresponding weight

step

protected int step
current step, i.e., current number of already combined estimators

realMode

protected boolean realMode
Indicates whether the adaptive estimator is in 'RealFunction' mode, i.e., the functions returned from the wrapped aggregation function will be treated as objects of type RealFunction. Otherwise objects of type Function consuming objects of type Number will be assumed.

convexMergeFunction

protected Function<java.lang.Object,? extends java.lang.Object> convexMergeFunction
Internal factory for the convex-linear merge of two objects. Typically, this is realized by building a convex linear combination of two RealFunctions.

public AdaptiveAggregationFunction(AggregationFunction function)

Method Detail

invoke

public java.lang.Object invoke(java.lang.Object old,
                               java.lang.Object next)
Two-figured function call for supporting aggregation by this function. Each aggregation function must support a function call like agg_n = f (agg_n-1, next). There, agg_n denotes the computed aggregation value after n steps, f the aggregation function, agg_n-1 the computed aggregation value after n-1 steps and next the next object to use for computation. This method delivers only null as aggregation result as long as the aggregation has not yet been initialized.

Specified by:
invoke in class AggregationFunction<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>
Parameters:
old - result of the aggregation function in the previous computation step
next - next object used for computation
Returns:
aggregation value after n steps
